result.execSummary:
All charges against Jillian Marie Hinderks in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jillian Marie Hinderks is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:21 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Jillian Marie Hinderks in court.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Jillian Marie Hinderks.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM301, 22CM304, 22CM305, and 22CM360. ADA Rockow recites resolution. Atty Anderson agrees. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 in 22CM304 DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM304. On motion of the State without objection, Court reads-in and dismisses Count 1 in 22CM301 and outright dismisses Count 1 in 22CM305 and Counts 1-3 in 22CM360. Sentencing arguments. 

Court orders: 

Count 1 in 22CM304

W/S 1 year probation

- Court Costs: $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
- No abusive contact with Bobby S.
- AODA and follow through
- Absolute sobriety- may be verified by testing through agent
- Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and Department of Corrections
- Report to probation by 12:00 PM on 9/19/22
- 4 days credit in the event of revocation

Costs and DNA to be added to current payment plan through Clerk of Court. Defendant to continue making payments towards payment plan.  gll
to reschedule PLEAS for 9/19/22, filed by Atty Anderson.  Per RMW on 8/12/22- Approved. JA rescheduled. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

for bond modification- Victims. Filed by Victim. arc    07/14/22 Per RMW, Addressed in count on 07/13/22. arc

* AMENDED *
- INCLUDES: 22CM301, 22CM304, 22CM305, and 22CM360

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, BobbyS. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Bobby S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
